User Editing Handler

app.handlers.edit_users.handle_edit_user(db, auth, user_id, permission)[source]

Edit properties of an existing user.

Displays a menu allowing changes to username, email, password, or access level (role). Available options depend on the caller’s permissions. After collecting updated fields, the function applies changes through the database and reports success or failure.

Parameters:

  • db (Database) – Database interface used to retrieve and update user records.

  • auth (Auth) – Authentication handler used for password hashing.

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user to edit.

  • permission (Permissions) – Permission manager used to verify whether the caller can modify the user’s access level.

Notes

  • If the user does not exist, the function prints a message and returns.

  • The “Change role” option only appears if the caller has user.edit_role permission.

  • Passwords are hashed before being stored.

  • Invalid menu choices result in no changes being applied.
